availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. McMillin (Monroe County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Black McMillin. Father of James McMillin, Black McMillin, Louisa McMillin, Benton McMillin, John McMillin, Elizabeth McMillin, and James McMillin. Married to Susan McMillin. Father of Willet McMillin. Farmer in Monroe County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Monroe County in 1850. Farmer in Monroe County in 1860. Owned twenty-nine enslaved persons in Monroe County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 399A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 10.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 187.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 72B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994049, Monroe County Births, p. 2.
"John Halsell McMillin (1808-1879)," Find A Grave, Memorial 45727224, accessed August 9, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/45727224.
